channel.title: Tech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Tech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: AI is too risky to insure, say people whose job is insuring risk
item.description: Major insurers including AIG, Great American, and WR Berkley are asking U.S. regulators for permission to exclude AI-related liabilities from corporat...

item.title: Beehiiv’s CEO isn’t worried about newsletter saturation
item.description: Beehiiv's co-founder and CEO Tyler Deck spoke to TechCrunch about why the company has been expanding, and where the media business is going next.

item.title: TechCrunch Mobility: Searching for the robotaxi tipping point
item.description: Welcome back to TechCrunch Mobility — your central hub for news and insights on the future of transportation.

item.title: ChatGPT told them they were special — their families say it led to tragedy
item.description: A wave of lawsuits against OpenAI detail how ChatGPT used manipulative language to isolate users from loved ones and make itself into their sole confi...

item.title: Waymo gets regulatory approval to expand across Bay Area and Southern California
item.description: Waymo continues to expand its reach, with the robotaxi company posting Friday that it’s now “officially authorized to drive fully autonomously across ...

item.title: Trump administration might not fight state AI regulations after all
item.description: A Trump administration order targeting state-level AI regulation is reportedly on hold.

item.title: Byju’s founder to appeal U.S. court order to pay over $1B in bankruptcy case
item.description: A U.S. bankruptcy court has ordered Byju's founder Byju Raveendran to pay over $1.07 billion in a case over missing company funds.

item.title: Trump administration might not fight state AI regulations after all
item.description: A Trump administration order targeting state-level AI regulation is reportedly on hold.

item.title: Meta wants to get into the electricity trading business
